title: The Designers Behind Badgley Mischka on Their Favorite Things at Home
text:
Text size

When designers Mark Badgley and James Mischka decide to relocate, there’s no hemming and hawing, no second-guessing—they act with lightning speed.

Take their recent 3,000-mile move from East Coast to West. The two are partners in business (they met at Parsons School of Design and launched their successful Badgley Mischka evening-gown line in 1988) and life (they married in 2013), and had been living in Centre Island, on Long Island’s storied Gold Coast. But they’ve long conducted a fair share of business in Los Angeles, where they maintain a flagship store and outfit celebrities (Kate Winslet, Helen Mirren, Jennifer Lopez, and Oprah Winfrey, among others) for the red carpet. So in late July of 2018, they began considering a switch. They committed to the idea in August, and moved in September.

“James and I are gypsies…spontaneous,” Badgley admits. “It baffles our friends but for some reason it doesn’t really daunt us.”

That kind of decisiveness—and gutsy come-what-may attitude—seems to serve them well. Both 58, the designers this month are celebrating their one-year anniversary in their newest home—a cozy 1940s bungalow ranch, nestled in a canyon between Beverly Hills and Bel Air.

Sitting beside the pool, they spoke with Penta about their five favorite things.

Courtesy of Badgley Mischka

A Bit of Horseplay (1)

Badgley: “In the living room, mixed in with sporting art, are portraits of our horses that have meant something to us. Snowden, the white one up at the top [left], passed away. Baltimore, below—he’s retired in Kentucky. Brando, the big dark bay with four white socks, is retired out in the Hamptons. McKinley, below, is the one I’m still currently showing.” [Badgley grew up riding and took up the sport again some 20 years ago, competing as a hunter rider in horse shows across the country as a way to de-stress. And James?] “James likes to watch.”

“ James and I are gypsies…spontaneous. It baffles our friends but for some reason it doesn’t really daunt us. ” —Mark Badgley

Mischka: [Chuckling.] “I just pet the horses.”

Courtesy of Badgley Mischka

Desk Set (2)

Mischka: “The Casablanca desk from our first Badgley Mischka Home collection is our favorite piece in the line. It’s all handmade—surfboard-finished on top like glass and the base is hand-gilded mahogany.”

Badgley: “It’s in a corner of our bedroom opposite an old brick fireplace. We initially designed [the arches] inverted, but when we chiseled out the shape, we turned it upside down and there was something much more provocative about it. Sleek, sensuous, with an Old World Hollywood look.”

Courtesy of Badgley Mischka

The Big Reveal (3)

Badgley: “We have a guest bedroom in this super-graphic Scalamandré print. Very Sunset Boulevard. Every time somebody opens that bedroom door, it’s sort of a wow. The print climbs up and down the walls, and across the furniture.”

Mischka: “I made tablecloths for the nightstands out of linen fabric that matched the wallpaper.”

Badgley: “It’s a great backdrop to anything. And very pet friendly. [They share their home with three dachshunds—Rommel, Whiskey, and Wally.] There’s something about it—a puppy can walk across anything in a cheetah print and you never see the paw prints.”

Courtesy of Badgley Mischka

Birds of a Feather (4)

Mischka: “We bought this pair of ceramic parrots at a fabulous antiques store just south of Lexington, Ky. [where the pair once owned a horse farm]. They’ve followed us around ever since. We love the glaze on them, the way they’re a little bit messy, a little imperfect.”

Badgley: “We started collecting them in different colors. Every once in a while, they show up at an estate sale or flea market.”

Mischka: “But only in the South. We think they’re from the 1930s.”

Badgley: “They always work and finish off a tabletop in a fun way.”

Pooling Their Resources

Mischka: “The house is actually a U-shape that wraps around the pool—with the master bedroom on one side, the office on the other. All rooms look onto the pool, which is right off the back door, with this long stretch of white brick.”

Badgley: “We spend a lot of time here, eat our meals here...”

Mischka: “Skype to the office from here.”

Badgley: “The house is kind of all about the pool.”
description: Among their favorite things are portraits of their horses, a desk set they designed, and a very impressive pool
